title: The Current: Summer 2023 | US EPA - U.S. EPA.gov
summary: The WaterSense program has helped consumers and businesses save a total of more than 7.5 trillion gallons of water by purchasing water-saving plumbing fixtures and irrigation products, with 1.1 trillion gallons saved in 2022 alone. WaterSense partners with more than 2,100 utilities, communities, manufacturers, home builders, retailers, and other organizations to produce and promote toilets, faucets, showerheads, spray sprinkler bodies, irrigation controllers and homes that are independently certified to use less water and perform well. Spray sprinkler nozzles, which are not yet eligible for the WaterSense label, can reduce the amount of water used for irrigation by distributing water more slowly, evenly, and with larger droplets—reducing runoff and misting.

title: International Code Council Releases 2021 International Water Conservation Code Provisions - Pro Builder
summary: The International Code Council recently released the 2021 International Water Conservation Code Provisions (IWCCP) in order to aid communities in tackling water scarcity, lowering utility expenses, and reducing carbon footprint. The comprehensive resource gives governments the tools they need to have a real impact in conserving water resources and includes provisions from the International Green Construction Code (IgCC) and International Energy Conservation Code (IECC). The 2021 IWCCP is an excellent tool for industry professionals to ensure that water conservation and efficient systems are established in large multi-unit residential and commercial buildings.

title: 2024 Will Be the Most Vegan Year Yet, According to These 2 Trend Predictors - VegNews
summary: According to trend forecasts, plant-based seafood will be the dominant trend in 2024. title: Car detailing services market to register $68.8 billion by 2033 - Carwash Online
summary: The global car detailing services market size was valued at $35.5 billion in 2022, and is projected to reach $68.8 billion by 2033, exhibiting a CAGR of 5.5% during the forecast period. The market is driven by rising consumer awareness about the importance of maintaining the aesthetics and functionality of their vehicles through professional car detailing services. The increasing trend of car enthusiasts and collectors is also contributing to the expansion of the market.

title: Qatar strives to lead on sustainability - GlobalCapital
summary: Qatar has set a goal of having renewable energy account for 20% of its total electricity generation capacity by 2030. The country is also investing heavily in carbon capture and sequestration technology, with a target of capturing 11 million tonnes of CO2 each year by 2035. Qatar's banks have been playing a key role in financing sustainable projects, and many lenders have been working to reduce their own emissions.

title: BharatAgri raises ₹35 cr Series A funding led by Arkam Ventures - BusinessLine
summary: BharatAgri, an advisory-led e-commerce platform for farmers, has raised $4.3 million in Series A funding led by Arkam Ventures. The funds will be used to scale up BharatAgri’s e-commerce platform and strengthen its last-mile delivery. BharatAgri uses smart farming advisory to help farmers identify and order the best input specific to their needs.

title: Union Cabinet approves NPK fertiliser subsidy for Rabi season; inclusion of Jamrani Dam Multipurpose Proje - The Economic Times
summary: The Union Cabinet has approved Nutrient Based Subsidy (NBS) rates for NPK fertiliser for the Rabi season, effective October 1, 2023, to March 30, 2024. The expenditure on subsidy is expected to cost Rs 22,303 crore. The cabinet also approved the inclusion of the Jamrani Dam Multipurpose Project of Uttarakhand under the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana-Accelerated Irrigation Benefit Programme (PMKSY-AIBP) at an estimated cost of Rs 2,584 crore.
